summary: This is a case overview memo from Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss dated November 5, 2020, summarizing the status of investigations and prosecutions related to Jeffrey Epstein. It mentions the ongoing sex trafficking case against Ghislaine Maxwell, motions practice that could reveal victim identities, and potential resolution with another Epstein co-conspirator.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Authored the case overview memo summarizing the status of Epstein-related investigations and prosecutions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the sex trafficking case U.S. v. Maxwell, with motions practice that may draw press attention, particularly regarding efforts to secure victim identities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The memo concerns cases and investigations stemming from his activities; he is referenced as the central figure whose associates are being prosecuted.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as an 'Epstein associate' in the context of the sex trafficking case against her.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution in U.S. v. Maxwell.

events.title: DAG Meeting Case Overview
events.description: Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss provides an overview of anticipated charges and investigative steps related to Epstein cases, including the status of U.S. v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a case overview from November 5, 2020, prepared by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.
It discusses the ongoing sex trafficking case U.S. v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Motions practice in Maxwell's case may draw press attention, particularly if she succeeds in efforts to secure the identities of specific victims.
Prosecutors are also working on a potential resolution with another Epstein co-conspirator, whose identity is not named in this excerpt.
